That is close minded. In "thinking outside of the box," you have closed your mind to, among other things, that which is inside of the box. That's fine, you're free to do that.

This subject is obviously something you feel very strongly about. I wonder what it is that has promted your ranting in these forums thought. You've likely seen something you didn't like regarding how a church handles abortion which has in turn completely biased your opinion to the degree that you would rather dictate to us your self-proclaimed worthless opinion, rather then submit your position with reasoned arguments so that they can be discussed rationally. Have fun partying it up.

Who was arguing that point? I'd like to know which ethical value the tax code falls under.

 
 Not necessarily anyone, I simply wanted to make the statement as a preface for the following comments in my original post.
 
 
What? My point is that if abortion was illegal then you wouldn't see dead baby in the streets...you either are building a strawman or missed my point. If you can provide evidence in other countries that having abortion being illegal will cause babies in streets then please show...but if one is pro-choice then you would think the mother (say in china) has every right to put there child in the street.

 
 As I said my comment has nothing to do with abortion laws but rather the legitimate truth that humans are capable of abandoning their young to their fate in an effort to circumvent 'legislation' -- a potential behaviour you refuse to accept.
 
 I have provided anecdotal evidence to bear, you don't accept it, and we end at a stalemate.
 
 Now onto the other issue... I feel I have proven that (a) abandoning babies to circumvent laws is a plausible human behaviour (b) that people already abandon babies today in my own culture without the added pressure of abortion being a criminal offence.
 
 I feel quite safe to say that, based on the above two facts, making abortion illegal will plausibly result in more babies being abandoned.
 
 Between the period of abandonment and discovery said infants will be at risk of injury or death from predators and/or exposure.
 
 
I don't really believe the death penalty is violation of a culture of life (note I am not saying I support the death penalty).

 
 You don't believe a society which condones government ordained murder known as 'execution' is in violation of this so called concept of a culture of life?
 
 ...I find this, well, quite staggering to be honest how you can make this statement -- the idea you can't recognise execution (death) and life as opposed to each other is, well farcical.
 
 
Be that as it may, I live in the USA and since I understand this culture the best I find no reason not to use my culture in examples.

 
 No, rather you apparently have no issue in using your culture to make generalised assumptions about other cultures. You refuse to accept said alien cultures could be so much different that your own -- the ethnocentric attitude.

legitimate truth that humans are capable of abandoning their young to their fate in an effort to circumvent 'legislation' -- a potential behaviour you refuse to accept.

Now onto the other issue... I feel I have proven that (a) abandoning babies to circumvent laws is a plausible human behaviour (b) that people already abandon babies today in my own culture without the added pressure of abortion being a criminal offence.
 
 I feel quite safe to say that, based on the above two facts, making abortion illegal will plausibly result in more babies being abandoned.
 
 Between the period of abandonment and discovery said infants will be at risk of injury or death from predators and/or exposure.
 
 
 You can't make that conclusion because it didn't happen when abortion was illegal. You haven't proven that the added "pressure" of abortion being illegal will cause more abandoned babies. I keep asking you to provide evidence for this and you can't. We didn't see a decrease in abandoned babies here in the US when abortion became legal. China obviously has a lot of babies on the streets and they abort the most! The amount of abandoned babies in the United States has actually increased over the past 15yrs ( i pick you US cause I can't find it anywhere else). So I don't see any correlation between abortion being illegal and abandoned babies increasing. 
 http://www.acf.hhs.gov/news/stats/abandon.htm
 
 
 
 
You don't believe a society which condones government ordained murder known as 'execution' is in violation of this so called concept of a culture of life?
 
 ...I find this, well, quite staggering to be honest how you can make this statement -- the idea you can't recognise execution (death) and life as opposed to each other is, well farcical.
